Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
The text mentions several sustainable and environmental practices that have been implemented in connection with Ketiara cooperative. Some key points include:

1. Organic agriculture: Ketiara uses organic farming methods, which help to preserve the soil, reduce the use of synthetic fertilizers and pesticides, promote biodiversity, and support a healthier ecosystem. This approach also helps to minimize the depletion of soil nutrients and to naturally control for pests.
2. Shade-grown coffee: As mentioned earlier, Ketiara grows its coffee trees under a shade canopy, which supports bird populations and fosters mutually beneficial relationships between these species and the coffee fields. This method also helps to minimize soil erosion and participate in a healthy ecosystem.
3. Fair Trade Premiums: The women of Ketiara cooperative invest a portion of their Fair Trade Premiums back into their farms, aiming to improve productivity and maintain quality. Additionally, they engage in various community development initiatives, such as improving health, education, public infrastructure, and environmental protection efforts in the surrounding area, including supporting the conservation of the nearby Leuser National Park.

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are several events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation within the provided context. Here are five examples:

1. Seasonal Wicked Good Community Garden: An annual event celebrating Earth Day, where the team works together to clean up the campus, tend to the community garden, and conserve the local environment.
2. Month-long Donation Drive: Another event focused on environmental conservation, where Wicked Joe collects non-perishable items and funds to donate to the Mid Coast Hunger Prevention Program (MCHPP). The company hopes to raise awareness for these causes and celebrate the success of their fundraising efforts through a walkathon.
3. Supporting Ketiara: By purchasing fair trade coffee, Wicked Joe supports the women of Ketiara who work hard to create opportunities for themselves and others in their community. A portion of the Fair Trade Premiums is invested back into the farms to improve productivity and maintain quality. Additionally, the company helps to protect the ecosystem of the nearby Leuser National Park through various initiatives.
4. Sustainable Coffee Production: As a coffee roasting business, Wicked Joe prioritizes sustainability in their sourcing and production methods. Their commitment to conserving the environment extends beyond their community garden and into the very products they sell.
5. Educational Workshops and Events: Throughout the year, Wicked Joe hosts educational workshops and events focusing on topics like composting, urban agriculture, and reducing waste. These events not only promote environmental conservation but also foster a sense of community among participants.

source.content: Earth Day also signifies the annual kick-off for the seasonal Wicked Good Community Garden Since the inception of this initiative our team has took this holiday to be a call to action - spending the afternoon picking up trash around our campus working on our community garden and being in nature Members of our team work together to celebrate and conserve our local environment - laying down a fresh foundation for our Wicked Good Community Garden and tending to the ecosystem surrounding A core value of our coffee roasting business is sustainability - sourcing and using practices in a manner that is kind to our Earth in order to make wicked good coffee It’s really special to be a part of a team that goes the next step - creating a space for nature to thrive and which brings us all together for a greater good Beyond supplying some natural sustainable and organic goods for members of our team a portion also gets donated to both the Maine Mid Coast Hunger Prevention Program MCHPP and the

During the summer we operate our Wicked Good Community Garden This significant project has been continuously inspired executed and evolved by leaders and members of our production team since  Starting with 6 beds and seedlings sourced from local organic farmers we have grown to host 12 beds as of  Bird boxes and bees have also graced this thriving plot - while fruit trees have been planted firmly in its soil The dream is to one day have a permanent greenhouse to enable further growth and production of organic goods to support our local community needs Earth Day is an international celebration which raises public awareness concerning environmental issues affecting our planet and over the last few years also representing an acknowledgement of climate change and global warming At Wicked Joe Earth Day also signifies the annual kick-off for the seasonal Wicked Good Community Garden Since the inception of this initiative our team has took this holiday to be a call to action - spending the

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, the organization has made several public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. They have become a certified B Corp, which confirms their ongoing efforts to use business as a force for good in the world. Additionally, they have altered the legal framework of their company to specifically protect their stakeholders and preserve their values over time. The organization also emphasizes its mission-based approach, which includes providing exceptional coffee while strengthening the environment, farmers, staff, and community. Furthermore, they prioritize fair trade practices, ensuring income sustainability, empowerment, individual and community well-being, and environmental protection. Lastly, they have received recognition from B Lab for being ranked "Best in the World" for community impact, showcasing their dedication to making a positive difference in the world.

source.content: The B Corp certification confirms Wicked Joe coffee’s ongoing efforts to leverage our business to address social and environmental problems while staying accountable to our employees customers suppliers and the planet In becoming a certified B Corp company we proudly join a community of companies committed to using business and economic success as a force for good in the world At Wicked Joe we’re constantly examining and reexamining every aspect of our business to make sure we’re operating in the most efficient and sustainable ways possible As an organization we've altered the legal framework of our company to specifically protect our stakeholders and preserve our values over time I felt like this would be a good opportunity to find out whether we were doing as good a job as we think we are shared Bob Garver co-owner of Wicked Joe Organic Coffees and Wicked Leaf Organic Teas We wanted to be a mission-based company long before B Corp started We always strive to be better This allows us

shared Bob Garver co-owner of Wicked Joe Organic Coffees and Wicked Leaf Organic Teas We wanted to be a mission-based company long before B Corp started We always strive to be better This allows us in some ways to quantify that Wicked Joe’s Mission is to provide our customers with extraordinary coffees in a manner that strengthens the environment our farmers our staff and our community We are proud to say that in  for the fifth year in a row we have been recognized by B Corp as ranking Best in the World for Community This list acknowledges B Corp businesses that scored in the top 5 for their efforts and top performance in contributing to the economic and social well-being of the communities in which they operate Through their exemplary practices and policies directed at community impact they're building a shared and sustainable prosperity for all Wicked Joe's mission-driven culture which embraces supplier relations social engagement charitable giving and strong diverse communities has

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Are there annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments? If yes, then summarize.
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, Wicked Joe Organic Coffee publishes annual reports that provide detailed information about their commitments related to global citizenship, the planet, and their partnerships with various organizations. The reports highlight the progress made towards achieving their goals, which include sourcing high-quality organic coffee, supporting small-scale farmer cooperatives, promoting fair labor practices, reducing waste and carbon emissions, and contributing to local communities. Additionally, Wicked Joe regularly updates its website with newsletters and blog posts that keep stakeholders informed about their latest initiatives and achievements.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: What community or social events have been organized to fulfill these commitments?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result:
Throughout the year, various community and social events have been organized to fulfill the commitments mentioned above. Some notable events include:

1. Monthly Farmers Markets: Regular markets are held every weekend, providing a platform for local farmers, producers, and artisans to showcase and sell their products directly to consumers. This not only supports small-scale agriculture but also fosters a sense of community through face-to-face interactions.
2. Annual Harvest Festival: Held during the autumn season, this festival celebrates the bountiful harvest while educating the community about sustainable farming practices, nutrition, and the importance of supporting local agriculture. The event typically features live music, cooking demos, farm tours, and activities for children.
3. Green Living Workshops: Periodically throughout the year, workshops are hosted to teach residents about eco-friendly living practices such as composting, rainwater harvesting, and energy efficiency. These workshops aim to promote environmental stewardship and encourage community members to adopt sustainable habits at home.
4. Neighborhood Clean-up Days: Organized several times a year, volunteers come together to participate in neighborhood-wide clean-up days. This event helps to keep the community beautiful while promoting a sense of unity and pride among its residents.
5. School Garden Programs: Local schools partner with community gardens to establish educational garden programs. Students learn about plant biology, nutrition, and the importance of sustainable agriculture while contributing to the maintenance and growth of the school garden. This program fosters a connection between students, their local food system, and the environment.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: The key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce involve various stakeholders such as producers, manufacturers, retailers, consumers, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), governments, and local communities. These partnerships aim to create a more equitable, transparent, and sustainable global marketplace. Examples include fair trade certifications like Fair Trade USA, which ensures that farmers, workers, and fishermen receive fair wages and safe working conditions; direct trade relationships between roasters and coffee producers, allowing for greater transparency and stronger connections between parties; and initiatives focused on environmental stewardship, such as the Rainforest Alliance, which works to conserve biodiversity and promote sustainable land use practices. Additionally, there are numerous collaborative efforts among NGOs, governments, and private sector actors to develop and implement industry-wide standards and guidelines that prioritize social and environmental responsibility.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
The employee/participant benefits highlighted in the provided information are as follows:

1. Access to free coffee and tea on the premises.
2. Company card redeemable for drinks with a 50 discount at Bard Coffee in Portland.
3. Opportunity for Garden Club members to volunteer and manage the community garden.
4. Various insurance options such as Harvard Pilgrim Medical Health Benefits, Boston Mutual Supplemental Health Long Term Life Insurance, and Short Term Disability.
5. Unique perks including a four-day workweek, dynamic company culture allowing team members to expand their skills and knowledge across various positions, and opportunities for personal growth within the Wicked Joe family.

global citizens and the planet That’s why we’re committed to making the right choices the most obvious ones Based on the simple idea that the products we buy and sell are connected to the livelihoods of others fair trade is a way to make a conscious choice for a better world A choice for Fair Trade Certified™ goods is a choice to support responsible companies empower farmers workers and fishermen and protect the environment In other words it’s a world-changing way of doing business ✩ Income Sustainability Ensures that the farmers workers and fishermen have the money needed to invest in their lives and their work ✩ Empowerment Giving farmers workers and fishermen a voice in the workplace and the community ✩ Individual  Community Well-Being A model that is fueled by committees of farmers workers and fishermen who decide how to invest their Fair Trade Community ✩ Development Funds based on their community's greatest needs - often clean water education and health care ✩ Environmental

Financials & Funding.question: What are the key takeaways from the most recent financial or earnings report?
Financials & Funding.result:
The latest financial or earnings report for Wicked Joe Organic Coffees and Wicked Leaf Organic Teas highlights several noteworthy achievements and initiatives. Some of the main points include:

1. B Corp recognition: For the fifth consecutive year, Wicked Joe has been ranked among the "Best in the World" for community impact by B Corp. This prestigious recognition showcases the company's commitment to leveraging its business operations for social and environmental good, while maintaining accountability to various stakeholders such as employees, customers, suppliers, and the planet.
2. Continued growth and expansion: Despite facing challenges in the industry, Wicked Joe has managed to grow its business and expand its product offerings. This includes introducing new organic teas alongside their existing line of organic coffees.
3. Focus on sustainability and social responsibility: Wicked Joe remains dedicated to promoting sustainability and social responsibility throughout its supply chain. By sourcing high-quality ingredients from ethical and environmentally friendly sources, the company demonstrates its commitment to supporting local farmers, workers, and fishermen, as well as preserving the environment.
4. Employee benefits and well-being: To foster a positive work culture and promote employee satisfaction, Wicked Joe offers various perks and benefits, including discounts on coffee and tea, opportunities for professional development, and access to community gardens where team members can participate in gardening activities and learn about sustainable agriculture practices.

shared Bob Garver co-owner of Wicked Joe Organic Coffees and Wicked Leaf Organic Teas We wanted to be a mission-based company long before B Corp started We always strive to be better This allows us in some ways to quantify that Wicked Joe’s Mission is to provide our customers with extraordinary coffees in a manner that strengthens the environment our farmers our staff and our community We are proud to say that in  for the fifth year in a row we have been recognized by B Corp as ranking Best in the World for Community This list acknowledges B Corp businesses that scored in the top 5 for their efforts and top performance in contributing to the economic and social well-being of the communities in which they operate Through their exemplary practices and policies directed at community impact they're building a shared and sustainable prosperity for all Wicked Joe's mission-driven culture which embraces supplier relations social engagement charitable giving and strong diverse communities has

The B Corp certification confirms Wicked Joe coffee’s ongoing efforts to leverage our business to address social and environmental problems while staying accountable to our employees customers suppliers and the planet In becoming a certified B Corp company we proudly join a community of companies committed to using business and economic success as a force for good in the world At Wicked Joe we’re constantly examining and reexamining every aspect of our business to make sure we’re operating in the most efficient and sustainable ways possible As an organization we've altered the legal framework of our company to specifically protect our stakeholders and preserve our values over time I felt like this would be a good opportunity to find out whether we were doing as good a job as we think we are shared Bob Garver co-owner of Wicked Joe Organic Coffees and Wicked Leaf Organic Teas We wanted to be a mission-based company long before B Corp started We always strive to be better This allows us

that Ketiara is made up of over 50 women These women work hard to create opportunities for themselves and others in the surrounding community They invest a portion of their Fair Trade Premiums directly back into the farms to improve productivity and maintain quality Other initiatives include improving health education public infrastructure and helping to protect the ecosystem of the nearby Leuser National Park

harvested organic produce to local food banks This year has been no different but in an effort to get more community engagement they came up with this month-long event We collected non-perishable items in the front lobby of our Roastery until September 12th - you may have seen the signs out on the road Our goal was to gather at least  items and  dollars to donate to MCHPP which we far exceeded All these efforts to fundraise culminated in our Walkathon on September 15th where physically walked donations over to MCHPP This was another way we hoped to spread awareness for these causes and celebrate the triumph of raising so many goods We find community in giving back and so we here at Wicked Joe and MCHPP are grateful for all the support shared by members of our community To donate directly or learn more about hunger relief and prevention efforts click here to check out Mid Coast Hunger Prevention Program's website

The Las Lajas Micromill in the Sabanilla de Alejuela region of Costa Rica shares many of the same founding principles and values as we do at Wicked Joe Organic Coffees A project that was originally founded in  Francisca and Oscar Chacon inherited a 5 hectare farm and in the past 20 years have transformed it into what it is today In  with coffee prices falling dramatically they sought out organic farming as the answer to a sustainable future This was not an easy feat to accomplish but it certainly paid off In  they began milling their own coffee and started a microlot program By doing their own processing they were able to better control the quality of their coffee This is also where they were eventually able to experiment and bring out new and interesting flavors in their coffee In  a huge earthquake hit Costa Rica leaving everyone without water or electricity in the middle of harvest season Francisca and Oscar knew that in Africa and Brazil they process coffee without water frequently

right to request that we complete the information you believe is incomplete The right to erasure – You have the right to request that we erase your personal data under certain conditions The right to restrict processing – You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data under certain conditions The right to object to processing – You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data under certain conditions The right to data portability – You have the right to request that we transfer the data that we have collected to another organization or directly to you under certain conditions If you make a request we have one month to respond to you If you would like to exercise any of these rights please contact us Another part of our priority is adding protection for children while using the internet We encourage parents and guardians to observe participate in and/or monitor and guide their online activity Wicked Joe Organic Coffees does not
